METS:xmlData.dcterms:title: Evropa zdaj! Programski pogledi slovenskih političnih strank, predvsem slovenskih komunistov na ≫Evropo≪ v procesu demokratizacije in osamosvajanja
METS:xmlData.dcterms:alternative: Europe Now! (The programme standpoints of Slovenian political parties, especially Slovenian communists, in regard to ≫Europe≪ in the process of democratisation and the attainment of Independence)
METS:xmlData.dcterms:creator: Čepič, Zdenko
METS:xmlData.dcterms:abstract: V iskanje poti iz vsesplošne krize, v kateri je bila jugoslovanska država, se je oblikoval v Sloveniji proces demokratizacije. Ta je bil pogoj za osamosvojitev. S tem procesom demokratizacije, kot t. i. prenoviteljstvom, je začela Zveza komunistov Slovenije. Reformna politika ZKS je vrh dosegla konec leta 1989, ko je predstavila program ≫Za evropsko kakovost življenja≪. V njem je predstavila program pogledov slovenskih komunistov na celotno družbeno, politično, gospodarsko in socialno problematiko. Program je postal pod naslovom ≫Evropa zdaj!≪ tudi volilni program slovenskih komunistov za večstrankarske volitve aprila 1990. Bistvo programa ni bila napoved evropskega povezovanja, ampak da bi začeli ≫evropsko≪ živeti tukaj in zdaj.

In the course of trying to find a way out of the ovarall crisis within the state of Yugoslavia in the process of democratization in Slovenia, which was a necessary prerequisite for the attainment of Slovene independence, started to take shape. This process, also known as the renovation of the Communist Party, was initiated by the League of Communists of Slovenia. The League’s set of reforms culminated at the end of 1989 with the presentation of a program named ≫For the European Quality of Life”, in which Slovene communists listed their views on issues of social, politicai, societal, and economic nature. Known as ≫Europe Now!≪this program became the platform of Slovene communists in the multi-party elections in Aprii 1990. Rather than an announcement of European integration its principal idea was to start living ≫the European way≪in the here and now.
